channel.title: One Last Compile Question
channel.description:
I added a Public String thing, and i got this error...
[code]client.java:33: illegal start of expression public int mustsay = 0; ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
Can someone please help?
I already used google, and search bar...
Thanks

item.title: One Last Compile Question
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

	public String forceMsg;
	{
	public int mustsay = 0;
	}

Why do you have brackets around a string?

	public String forceMsg;
	public int mustsay = 0;

Read full topic

item.title: One Last Compile Question
item.dc:creator: @Gamerstips Gamerstips
item.description:
@Gamerstips wrote:

Were do i declare it in the correct place?

Heres here i declared it…

[code]/*

  • Client.java
  • Created by DdsSpeced
  •  Heavily modified by GamersTips.

*/
import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.BufferedWriter;
import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
import java.io.FileReader;
import java.io.FileWriter;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.Calendar;
import java.util.GregorianCalendar;
import java.util.Random;
import java.util.concurrent.CopyOnWriteArrayList;
import java.util.Timer;
import java.util.TimerTask;

//2400,4446

public class client extends Player implements Runnable {
public int[] lowTask = { 87, 100, 19, 1267, 181, 90, 112, 117, 78, 1153 };
public int[] mediumTask = { 87, 100, 19, 1267, 117, 78, 941, 1338, 912, 913, 914, 2591, 2604, 2610, 1153, 1154 };
public int[] highTask = { 1627, 181, 90, 112, 117, 78, 1183, 941, 2881, 2882, 2883, 2591, 2604, 2610, 1153, 1154 };
public int taskID = -1;
public int taskAmount = -1;

public String forceMsg;
{
public int mustsay = 0;
}
public int randomLowTask() 
{
	return lowTask[(int) (Math.random() * lowTask.length)];
}

public int randomMediumTask() 
{
	return mediumTask[(int) (Math.random() * mediumTask.length)];
}

public int randomHighTask() 
{
	return highTask[(int) (Math.random() * highTask.length)];
}[/code]
